＜Artificial Spirit＞ or Shumiya
Uktra Hill's
Nid Hogg
＜Artificial Spirit＞ or Shu Juna
Nid Hogg's
Ash tree

All cities +10% [ICON_Science] technology value, [ICON_Capital] extra +20% [ICON_Science] technology value. [NEWLINE]Happy cities get an additional +5% [ICON_Science] science. Cities with ecstatic happiness get double the bonus. [NEWLINE]Enemy spies are reduced by 1 level while in your territory, and another 1 level if the city is fully powered.
horror eater

All cities +10% [ICON_Science] science and technology value, double bonus in wartime. [NEWLINE]Improved strategic resources +2 [ICON_Science] technology value. [NEWLINE]Your spy level is increased by 1 during offensive actions.
or Shumiya
Or Shumiya (spiritual outfit)
Mori Juna
Or keep Juna (spiritual outfit)
run neatly

Your city's power requirements evolve with the times and technological advancements. When the city is fully powered, the output of each area will gain; but when the power supply is insufficient, it will get a debuff. Your Renewable Energy Generating Facility gains additional output buffs. [NEWLINE]When you capture or kill an enemy spy, the civilization will gain 150 [ICON_Science] technology points and 50 [ICON_Culture] points for each level of enhancement of the enemy spy.
trespass

Your city's power requirements evolve with the times and technological advancements. When the city is fully powered, the output of each area will gain; but when the power supply is insufficient, it will get a debuff. Your Industrial Zone power generation buildings gain additional output buffs. [NEWLINE] When the offensive espionage mission is successful, it will get 50% of the [ICON_Science] technology value and [ICON_Culture] culture value obtained by the target city in this round.
Spirit Awakening

In addition to the basic characteristics, when the military unit fights with more advanced units, +7[ICON_Strength] combat strength, with the development of technology, military units can get additional strengthening. Some of the abilities of the [ICON_Governor] governor employed in the city extend to your other cities. [NEWLINE]Unlocking Defensive Tactics Civics and Castle Techs grants you a free Spy (and extra Spy capacity) each. Spy deployment and offensive mission completion times have been greatly reduced.
computer world

Will try to gain [ICON_Science] technology, and like civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Science] technology development. Hate [ICON_Science] civilizations with backward technology. [NEWLINE]Envy civilizations that have entered the [ICON_Glory_Golden_Age] golden age. Dislikes civilizations entering the [ICON_Glory_Dark_Age] Dark Age. [NEWLINE]Want to be safe and unconquered. Dislikes civilizations that conquer other players' original capitals.

Will try to gain [ICON_Science] technology, and like civilizations that also focus on [ICON_Science] technology development. Hate [ICON_Science] civilizations with backward technology. [NEWLINE] Sympathize with civilizations caught in the [ICON_Glory_Dark_Age] Dark Age. Dislikes civilizations entering the [ICON_Glory_Golden_Age] golden age. [NEWLINE]Will try to loot all cells possible. Respect other civilizations that like to plunder.
Alien Observatory

Or keep the characteristic scientific development area. Replaces the Academy area and is less expensive to build. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Adjacent refineries provide +2 [ICON_Science] science bonus; for every 2 adjacent area cells, +1 [ICON_Science] science bonus.
+{1_num}[ICON_Science] Science from adjacent refinery tiles.
Otherworldly Refinery

+2 [ICON_Production] Production. +2 [ICON_Production] Production per adjacent strategic resource. [NEWLINE] Cities within three cells have doubled output of improved strategic resources (this effect cannot be stacked). [NEWLINE]Limited to one build per city.
+{1_num}[ICON_Production] Production comes from adjacent Atlas Refinery.
+{1_Num}[ICON_Production] Production comes from adjacent strategic resources.
Alien Transuranium Power Plant

Or keep characteristic buildings. [NEWLINE]This industrial area produces [ICON_Science] technology value equivalent to [ICON_Production] productivity adjacency bonus. [NEWLINE]Automatically convert any amount of [ICON_RESOURCE_ARUSU_ELERIUM]True to [ICON_Power]power and power cities within 6 cells at a rate of: [NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]1 [ICON_RESOURCE_ARUSU_ELERIUM]True[ICON_PowerRight] 16 points [ICON_Power] electricity. [NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet] released no carbon dioxide into the atmosphere. [NEWLINE]Its [ICON_Production] production and [ICON_Science] technology bonuses extend to all city centers within 6 tiles that do not receive power plant building bonuses.
Decommission the city's current power plant and replace it with a transuranium power plant. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Exura Power Plant:[NEWLINE]{LOC_BUILDING_ARUSU_ELERIUM_POWER_PLANT_DESCRIPTION}

CODE NAME: QUOLNIR [NEWLINE] We have completed analysis of a substance tentatively known as Transuranic-115, and it has been shown that the material does not belong to any element naturally occurring on Earth. Presumably aliens brought some to Earth from other planets that undoubtedly harbor large deposits of transuranium, but speculating on that is beyond me. What I do know for sure is that this matter reacts violently in the force field of high-energy particles, creating a near-infinite source of energy that defies all existing standards of efficiency. Regrettably, I have not been able to find a way to reproduce or synthesize this substance using all the resources available on earth. The materials we recover from aliens will likely constitute our entire available inventory. Commanders will choose carefully how to allocate these valuable resources. ＜Richard Teigen＞
Alien Research Center

Or keep featured buildings, unlocked by "Space Race". [NEWLINE]Your city grants an extraterrestrial UFO. [NEWLINE]All units gain life regen upon completion of construction. [NEWLINE] Research and development speed of items related to scientific victory +10%.
Invaders

Or keep the feature builder, can be used 8 times. [NEWLINE]Can build civilian and military cell improvements. [NEWLINE]Ability to use construction charges to speed up the progress of Academy, Space Center, and Libraries, Universities, and Research Labs by 25%.
UFO

Or defend a unique military unit. Obtained when completing the Otherworld Research Center. [NEWLINE]Retreat to the Otherworld Research Center with 1 life when killed. [NEWLINE]Has a unique power-up tree. [NEWLINE]Able to move and fight in water, and resistant to large-scale lethal weapons.
Plane Builder

Or keep the featured builder, replacing the builder. [NEWLINE]Can build cell improvements, delete some terrain (such as forest or rainforest) or harvest certain resources. . [NEWLINE]Ability to use construction charges to speed up the progress of Academy, Space Center, and Libraries, Universities, and Research Labs by 20%.
Otherworld pioneer

Or keep the characteristic pioneers. [NEWLINE]New cities can be created. Upon completion, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] is reduced by 1. [NEWLINE]The developed city has gained several otherworldly builders.
alien colonists

Or keep the characteristics of advanced pioneers. [NEWLINE]New cities can be created. Upon completion, the population of the city [ICON_Citizen] is reduced by 1. [NEWLINE]The developed city has gained several otherworldly builders. If you unlock the required technology, you will also get UFO from the other world.
Infiltrator
Or keep featured spies. Has a unique reinforcement tree. [NEWLINE]Run undercover missions in foreign cities and protect your cities from enemy spies.
Alien Infantry
Or defend the unique Atomic Age melee unit. Has a unique reinforcement tree. [NEWLINE]Gain a boost when working with UFOs.
Alien Machine Gun
Or keep the unique atomic age ranged unit, replacing the machine gun. [NEWLINE]Gain a boost when working with UFOs.
Alien Tank
Or defend the characteristic information age heavy armor unit, replacing modern tanks. [NEWLINE]Gain a boost when working with UFOs.
U.F.O
hive mind
+1 aircraft slot. Alien units within 2 cells have +1 extra attack times per round, and will not suffer combat debuffs when they are damaged.
mind control
Allied cities within 2 cells have +10 [ICON_Loyalty] loyalty; enemy cities within 2 cells have -10 [ICON_Loyalty] loyalty.
Rare prime armor
weakness
+17[ICON_Strength] combat power when defending, but -17[ICON_Strength] combat power when defending flying units.
Xenograft implantation
Alien units within 2 cells gain vision +1 and invisibility, and can still move after attacking.
Cloning chamber

Outsider units within 2 cells recover at the end of each turn, even after moving or attacking. [NEWLINE]Gain an additional one when training units in the city. [NEWLINE]Enemy spies are prohibited from invading territory.
Hive Mind Network
+1 extra attack per round. [NEWLINE]Will not suffer combat debuffs when taking damage.
Alien camouflage
+1 vision. Only adjacent enemy units can spot the unit. [NEWLINE]Can still move after attacking.
Clonal proliferation
Recovers at the end of each turn, even after moving or attacking.
infiltrator
counterintelligence
Counterintelligence level 2, has higher counterintelligence capabilities, and all city areas are protected (area within 1 cell + 1 action level).
prankster
Destruction level 2, with a higher chance of successfully causing damage. [NEWLINE]Destroy a dam level 2 for a higher chance of successfully destroying a dam.
deep network
If the spy is in your own territory, all your spies get +1 action level, and all enemy spies in your territory get -1 action level.
master thief

Fund interception level 2 has a higher probability of successfully extracting gold coins. [NEWLINE]Great Work Stealing Level 2 has a higher chance of successfully stealing a Great Work, Relic, or Artifact.
dirty politics

Guerrilla recruitment level 2, higher chance to successfully spawn rebel units. [NEWLINE]Create turmoil level 2, have a higher chance of successfully creating turmoil. [NEWLINE]Fake Scandal Level 2, with a higher chance of successfully fabricating a scandal.
master assassin

Deploying in enemy cities does not take time. [NEWLINE]Frame the Chief Executive Level 2, there is a higher chance of successfully framing the Chief Executive. [NEWLINE]Increased chance to flee (+4 rank) if hunted while running a quest.
black man

Time to complete all quests is reduced by 25%. [NEWLINE]Technology Stealing level 2 has a higher chance of successfully obtaining advanced technology. [NEWLINE]Technology Interference Level 2 has a higher chance of successfully disrupting rocket technology.
armored vehicle
Research and develop internal combustion engines to provide +{1_Amount}[ICON_Strength] combat strength
+{1_Amount}[ICON_Strength] Combat Strength
Gatling
Research and development guidance system provides +{1_Amount} additional attack times
If [ICON_Movement] movement allows, +{1_Amount} extra attacks
instant messaging
Research and development of telecommunications provides +5 [ICON_Strength] combat power and +1 [ICON_Movement] movement power.
+{1_Amount}[ICON_Strength] Combat Strength
+{1_Amount}[ICON_Movement] Movement

Do you have real affection for machines?
Don't call me by the same name as that kid! I have a name that only belongs to me... or Shu Juna, the only thing my father gave me!
<world Tree>
<Evil Dragon>

Appeared in front of Shidou when Shidao was experiencing the new somatosensory game "MY LITTLE Shidou 2", claiming to be an artificial elf, hoping that Shidao would tell himself what "love" is. The appearance is a girl with bright white long hair and clear blue eyes, wearing a white dress with a large black cross emblem.
In the end, the spiritual outfit from when he was an elf appeared, reminiscent of Fraxinus.

The girl who suddenly appeared in front of Shidou, who looked similar to Moriya, seemed to only appear after dusk, and liked to tease Shidou. I am very interested in Shidou's performance in "Computer World". Contrary to Moriya, she has iron-black hair and golden eyes. The clothing is based on the nun's clothing, with black as the main color, an inverted cross pattern on the front, and a square edge representing the process BUG on the skirt.

The exposure of the spiritual outfit is very high, the pupils become black spots, the color of the pupils turns red, and the tail of the hair has a golden color. The whole body is wrapped in code, the wings woven by code spread out, and the BUG-shaped block extends to the body. The shape is based on the design concept of the black dragon Nid Hogg who ate the world tree.
Identification name: artificial elf; at first there was only the surname "or Shou", and later, under Shidou's whim, he named her "Jia (まりあ)" based on the concept of a nun's clothing
Identification name: artificial elf; the same design concept as Jua's normal clothing is based on nuns, and the black clothing has a large golden inverted cross emblem, which is quite eye-catching.
atomic theism
The Atomic Cult is a religious group that worships radiation and nuclear weapons, which they believe will give them new life.

As the name suggests, the Atomists are a religion built around the God of the Atom, which teaches that the entire universe exists within the atoms of everything. With the fission of the atom god the universe will also split in two. Therefore, Atomism believes that the atom is the god of the creator, who creates a new world through the nuclear fission reaction.

In the concept of Atom believers, the Great War is revered as a divine creation that creates infinite new worlds in an instant, which represents the unity and creation of the God of Atoms, that is, the generation of radiation.

The Atomists express their admiration for the God of Atoms by worshiping radiation, his flickering light. They believe that it has the ability to transform real things and create a better world, which makes the above-mentioned great division possible. The God of Atoms Split worlds and bring them back to life by shining light. While "purification" by nuclear explosions is the best option for completing the Sundering, casualties caused by radiation or natural causes also fit within the teachings of the Atomists.
